intro: Crepis setosa subsp. setosa, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy, linear leaves and small, yellowish flower heads. The plant typically thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its inflorescence consists of a cluster of tiny florets, which are often hidden beneath the leaves. Crepis setosa subsp. setosa is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
